endpoints_summary.summary: List issues for a given set of packages  (Currently not available to all customers)

details.description:
Get a list of an organization's issues.

#### Required permissions

- `View Organization (org.read)`

- `View Projects (org.project.read)`

- `View Project history (org.project.snapshot.read)`

parameters.description: A filter to select issues updated before this date.
parameters.name: updated_before

parameters.description: A filter to select issues updated after this date.
parameters.name: updated_after

parameters.description: A filter to select issues created before this date.
parameters.name: created_before

parameters.description: A filter to select issues created after this date.
parameters.name: created_after

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: The request was missing these required fields: ...

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

version.description: Version of the JSON API specification this server supports.

endpoints.summary: List issues for a given set of packages  (Currently not available to all customers)

details.description:
This endpoint is currently restricted and is not available to all customers. Query issues for a batch of packages identified by Package URL (purl). Only direct vulnerabilities are returned; transitive vulnerabilities (from dependencies) are not included as they can vary depending on the context.

#### Required permissions

- `View Organization (org.read)`

200.description: Returns an array of issues with the purl identifier of the package that caused them

details.summary: List issues for a given set of packages  (Currently not available to all customers)

representations.description: The affected versions of this vulnerability.

disclosed_at.description: When this problem was disclosed to the public.

discovered_at.description: When this problem was first discovered.

updated_at.description: When this problem was last updated.

url.description: An optional URL for this problem.

ResourcePathRepresentation.description: An object that contains an opaque identifying string.

ChecksumValidationMeta.description: Metadata about checksum validation when a checksum qualifier is provided in the PURL

description.description: Human-readable explanation of the validation result

checksum.description: Whether the checksum matched (null if no checksum validation was requested)

name_version.description: Whether the package name and version were found

checksum.description: The checksum value provided (null if none)

type.description: The type of match found: - `full`: Both package ID and checksum match - `partial`: Only one of package ID or checksum matches - `none`: Neither package ID nor checksum found

namespace.description: A name prefix, such as a maven group id or docker image owner

description.description: A markdown-formatted optional description of this remedy.
description.example: Upgrade the package version to 5.4.0,6.4.0 to fix this vulnerability

upgrade_package.description: A minimum version to upgrade to in order to remedy the issue.

type.description: The type of the remedy. Always ‘indeterminate’.

purls.description: An array of Package URLs (purl). Supported purl types are apk, cargo, cocoapods, composer, conan, deb, gem, generic, golang, hex, maven, npm, nuget, pub, pypi, rpm, and swift. A version for the package is also required.

sources.description: Sources for determining exploit maturity level, e.g., CISA, ExploitDB, Snyk.

description.description: A description of the issue in Markdown format
description.example:
## Overview


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to XML External Entity (XXE) Injection.

effective_severity_level.description: The type from enumeration of the issue’s severity level. This is usually set from the issue’s producer, but can be overridden by policies.

severities.description: An array of dictionaries containing all known data related to the vulnerability

title.description: A human-readable title for this issue.

updated_at.description: When the vulnerability information was last modified.

id.description: The Snyk ID of the vulnerability.

type.description: The type of the REST resource. Always ‘issue’.

packages.description:
Package metadata and checksum validation results, keyed by PURL.
Keys must be valid Package URLs (e.g., "pkg:maven/com.example/foo@1.0.0").

level.description: Level of severity calculated via vector

score.description: The CVSS score calculated from the vector, representing the severity of the vulnerability on a scale from 0 to 10.

source.description: The source of this severity. The value must be the id of a referenced problem or class, in which case that problem or class is the source of this issue. If source is omitted, this severity is sourced internally in the Snyk application.

type.description: Indicates if the CVSS item is primary or secondary. Clients should prefer the primary CVSS vector.

vector.description: CVSS vector string detailing the metrics of a vulnerability.

format.description: The standard by which the “maturity” value is shown.

level.description: Exploit maturity of the vulnerability. For CVSSv3: Proof of Concept, Functional, High. For CVSSv4: Unreported, Proof of Concept, Attacked.

type.description: Indicates if the CVSS item is primary or secondary. Clients should prefer the primary CVSS vector.

namespace.description: A name prefix, such as a maven group id or docker image owner

disclosure_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was disclosed.

publication_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was published.

title.description: Descriptor for an external reference to the issue

url.description: URL for an external reference to the issue
